intro: Cordia bombardensis, commonly known as the Brazilian star-apple tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red fruits that are rich in nutrients and have a sweet, juicy pulp. Its botanical features include opposite leaves, five-petaled flowers, and a unique fruit structure that splits open when mature. Cordia bombardensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
